content.description: This is a great roof route at a crag that tends to dry early after rain due to its southern aspect. Walk up the slab heading toward the roof. Using awkward, blocky holds (crux), gain a stance under the roof. Traverse around the roof, and follow the crack to the top. Not much actual jamming is involved, but it is a nice climb regardless with a beautiful view and decent exposure.
content.location: From the bottom, locate a short slab leading to a good-sized roof with a crack splitting it on its right side. For a toprope, from the summit, locate a large tree in-line with a hand-crack running up a slab.

content.description: The Roof is the next obvious feature up the trail with a few great lines with good exposure. A family a ravens claims this feature for its spring nest, but the young have usually fledged by late May.
